goals.question: What is the distribution of group sizes?
goals.rationale: This tells us about the frequency of different group sizes in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the most common group type?
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the distribution of group types and identify the most common type.

goals.question: What is the average age of group members?
goals.rationale: This gives us an idea of the central tendency and spread of age in the dataset.

goals.question: How does the group size vary by group type?
goals.visualization: Box plot of group_size by group_type
goals.rationale: This helps us understand if there are any differences in group size based on the type of group.

goals.question: What is the gender distribution within each group type?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of gender by group_type
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the gender composition of each group type and identify any patterns or differences.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['group_size'] = data['group_size'].astype(int)
    plt.hist(data['group_size'], bins=20, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    plt.axvline(data['group_size'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Mean: {data['group_size'].mean():.2f}")
    plt.axvline(data['group_size'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['group_size'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of group sizes?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['group_type'].value_counts().plot(kind='bar')
    plt.title('What is the most common group type?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['age'] = pd.to_numeric(data['age'], errors='coerce')
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.boxplot(data['age'].dropna(), vert=False)
    ax.set_title('What is the average age of group members?')
    ax.axvline(data['age'].mean(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Mean: {data["age"].mean():.2f}')
    ax.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['group_type'] = data['group_type'].astype('category')
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.boxplot(data.groupby('group_type')['group_size'].apply(list), labels=data['group_type'].unique())
    ax.set_xlabel('Group Type')
    ax.set_ylabel('Group Size')
    ax.set_title('How does the group size vary by group type?')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['count'] = 1
    gender_group = data.groupby(['group_type', 'gender']).count()['count'].unstack()
    gender_group.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
    plt.title('What is the gender distribution within each group type?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(title='Gender', loc='upper right')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
